revision.text: Major General Mohamed Zahir is the Chief of Staff of the Maldives National Defence Force of the Republic of Maldives.[[Image:mohamedzahir.jpg]]

[[Image:mohamedzahir.jpg|right|thumb]]
{{verify}}
Major General '''Mohamed Zahir''' is the Chief of Staff of the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] (MNDF) of the [[Republic of Maldives]]. He assumed command as Chief of Staff of MNDF, formerly know as the National Security Service (NSS)on the 11th of November 1996 as a Brigadier. He was promoted to the rank of Major General on 21st April 2004. He is also the chairman of the MNDF Advisory Council, the highest forum of senior serving officers.
After completion of secondary education in 1972, Major General Mohamed Zahir joined the civil service and worked in various Governments Departments before enlisting in the Maldives National Defence Force in 1978 to the rank of Sergeant and was commissioned to an officer two years later.
During his past years of service, he has undertaken various commands positions with in different Units of the MNDF. Before assuming the duties of the Chief of Staff of MNDF, he was also the Deputy Chief of Staff of MNDF. During this tenure, he played an integral role in conceptualizing and doctrinally developing the operational functioning of all the arms and services of the MNDF. He has also commanded the Defence Institute for Training and Education, formerly known as NSS Training Unit whereby laying the groundwork for restructure and streamlining overall training policies.
For his gallant actions in the incidents of 1988, when a foreign mercenaries from neighboring Srilanka attacked the capital Male', he was awarded the second highest gallantry award, the Medal for Exceptional Bravery. In addition, he is also decorated with the Presidential Medal, Distinguished Service Medal and the Dedicated Service Medal.

[[Image:mohamedzahir.jpg|right|thumb]]
{{verify}}

[[Image:ChiefofStaffMaldives.jpg ]] Major General '''Mohamed Zahir''' ([[Dhivehi]]: މުހައްމަދު ޒާހިރު) is the Chief of Staff of the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] of the [[Republic of Maldives]]. He assumed command as [[Chief of Staff]] of MNDF, formerly know as the National Security Service (NSS) on the [[November 11]], [[1996]] as a [[Brigadier]]. He was promoted to the rank of Major General on [[April 21]], [[2004]]. He is also the chairman of the MNDF Advisory Council, the highest forum of senior serving officers.
After completion of secondary education in [[1972]], Mohamed Zahir joined the civil service and worked in various Governments Departments before enlisting in the Maldives National Defence Force in 1978 to the rank of [[Sergeant]] and was commissioned to an officer two years later.
During his past years of service, he has undertaken various commands positions with in different Units of the MNDF. Before assuming the duties of the Chief of Staff of MNDF, he was also the Deputy Chief of Staff of MNDF. During this tenure, he played an integral role in conceptualizing and doctrinally developing the operational functioning of all the arms and services of the MNDF. He has also commanded the Defence Institute for Training and Education, formerly known as NSS Training Unit whereby laying the groundwork for restructure and streamlining overall training policies.
For his gallant actions in the incidents of [[1988]], when a group of foreign mercenaries from [[Srilanka]] attacked the capital [[Malé]], he was awarded the second highest gallantry award, the Medal for Exceptional Bravery. In addition, he is also decorated with the Presidential Medal, Distinguished Service Medal and the Dedicated Service Medal.
[[Category:Maldivian people]]

[[Image:22zahir.jpg|thumb|right|Major General Mohamed Zahir]]
Major General '''Mohamed Zahir''' ([[Dhivehi]]: މުހައްމަދު ޒާހިރު) is the Chief of Staff of the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] of the [[Republic of Maldives]]. He assumed command as [[Chief of Staff]] of MNDF, formerly know as the National Security Service (NSS) on the [[November 11]], [[1996]] as a [[Brigadier]]. He was promoted to the rank of Major General on [[April 21]], [[2004]]. He is also the chairman of the MNDF Advisory Council, the highest forum of senior serving officers.
After completion of secondary education in [[1972]], Mohamed Zahir joined the civil service and worked in various Governments Departments before enlisting in the Maldives National Defence Force in 1978 to the rank of [[Sergeant]] and was commissioned to an officer two years later.
Major General Mohamed Zahir is a graduate of Police Training School, Handon, UK and the Naval Post Graduate School, Monterey, California, USA. He has also attended several seminars and conferences including Senior Executive Seminar on National and International Security at the Harvard University, USA, and Chiefs of Defence conferences world over.
During his past years of service, he has undertaken various command positions with in different Units of the MNDF. Before assuming the duties as the Chief of Staff of MNDF, he was also the Deputy Chief of Staff of MNDF. During this tenure, he played an integral role in conceptualizing and doctrinally developing the operational functioning of all the arms and services of the MNDF. He has also commanded the Defence Institute for Training and Education, formerly known as NSS Training Unit whereby laying the groundwork for restructure and streamlining overall training policies.
For his gallant actions in the incidents of [[1988]], when a group of foreign mercenaries from [[Srilanka]] attacked the capital [[Malé]], he was awarded the second highest gallantry award, the Medal for Exceptional Bravery. In addition, he is also decorated with the Presidential Medal, Distinguished Service Medal and the Dedicated Service Medal.
Major General Mohamed Zahir is married to Fathimath Amira. She is the Principal of the Centre for Higher Secondary Education. The General has four sons and one daughter.
==External link== * [http://www.airforce.lk/news/maldiveschiefvisit.htm Mohamed Zahir's visit to Sri Lanka Air Force]
[[Category:Maldivian people]]

He assumed command as [[Chief of staff (military)|Chief of Staff]] of MNDF, formerly know as the National Security Service (NSS) on the [[November 11]], [[1996]] as a [[Brigadier]]. He was promoted to the rank of Major General on [[April 21]], [[2004]]. He is also the chairman of the MNDF Advisory Council, the highest forum of senior serving officers. Major General Mohamed Zahir is also known to many Maldivians by the nickname, two two Zahir (22 Zahir).
After completion of secondary education in 1972, Mohamed Zahir joined the civil service and worked in various Governments Departments before enlisting in the Maldives National Defence Force in 1978 to the rank of [[Sergeant]] and was commissioned as an officer two years later.
Major General Mohamed Zahir is a graduate of [[Hendon Police College]], London, UK and the [[Naval Postgraduate School]], Monterey, United Sates. He also attended John F. Kennedy School of Government USA, in a program for Senior Excutives in National and International Security.

Before assuming the duties as the Chief of Staff of MNDF, he was also the Deputy Chief of Staff of MNDF. During this tenure, he played an integral role in conceptualizing and doctrinally developing the operational functioning of all the arms and services of the MNDF. He has also commanded the MNDF Defence Institute for Training and Education, formerly known as NSS Training Unit whereby laying the groundwork for restructure and streamlining overall training policies. In addition, he is also decorated with the Presidential Medal, Distinguished Service Medal and the Dedicated Service Medal.

Major General Mohamed Zahir is a graduate of [[Hendon Police College]], London, UK and the [[Naval Postgraduate School]], Monterey, United Sates. He also attended John F. Kennedy School of Government USA, in a program for Senior Excutives in National and International Security.

During this tenure, he played an integral role in conceptualizing and doctrinally developing the operational functioning of all the arms and services of the MNDF. He has also commanded the MNDF Defence Institute for Training and Education, formerly known as NSS Training Unit whereby laying the groundwork for restructure and streamlining overall training policies. Major General Mohamed Zahir's dedicated effort in the devolopment of the military has been highly appreciated by all ranks of Maldives National Defence Force.

In addition, he is also decorated with the Presidential Medal, Distinguished Service Medal and the Dedicated Service Medal.

Before assuming the duties as the Chief of Staff of MNDF, he was also the Deputy Chief of Staff of MNDF. During this tenure, he played an integral role in conceptualizing and doctrinally developing the operational functioning of all the arms and services of the MNDF. He has also commanded the MNDF Defence Institute for Training and Education, formerly known as NSS Training Unit whereby laying the groundwork for restructure and streamlining overall training policies. Major General Mohamed Zahir's dedicated effort in the devolopment of the military has been highly appreciated by all ranks of Maldives National Defence Force.
For his gallant actions in the incidents of 1988, when a group of [[PLOTE]] mercenaries from [[Sri Lanka]] attacked the capital [[Malé]], he was awarded the second highest gallantry award, the Medal for Exceptional Bravery. In addition, he is also decorated with the Presidential Medal, Distinguished Service Medal and the Dedicated Service Medal.
On 3rd November 2008 Maj. General (Ret.) Mohamed Zahir was awarded the nation's highest military decoration, the Medal of Honor by the former President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]].

Major General Mohamed Zahir is also known to many Maldivians by the nickname, two two Zahir (22 Zahir). He held the post of CDF until 18th November 2008.
After completion of secondary education in 1972, Mohamed Zahir joined the civil service and worked in various Governments Departments before enlisting in the Maldives National Defence Force in 1978 to the rank of [[Sergeant]] and was commissioned as an officer two years later.

During his past years of service, he has undertaken various command positions within different units of the MNDF. Before assuming the duties as the Chief of Staff of MNDF, he was also the Deputy Chief of Staff of MNDF. During this tenure, he played an integral role in conceptualizing and doctrinally developing the operational functioning of all the arms and services of the MNDF. He has also commanded the MNDF Defence Institute for Training and Education, formerly known as NSS Training Unit whereby laying the groundwork for restructure and streamlining overall training policies. Major General Mohamed Zahir's dedicated effort in the devolopment of the military has been highly appreciated by all ranks of Maldives National Defence Force.
For his gallant actions in the incidents of 1988, when a group of [[PLOTE]] mercenaries from [[Sri Lanka]] attacked the capital [[Malé]], he was awarded the second highest gallantry award, the Medal for Exceptional Bravery. In addition, he is also decorated with the Presidential Medal, Distinguished Service Medal and the Dedicated Service Medal.
On 3rd November 2008 Maj. General (Ret.) Mohamed Zahir was awarded the nation's highest military decoration, the Medal of Honor by the former President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]].
Major General Mohamed Zahir is married to Fathimath Amira. She is the Principal of the Centre for Higher Secondary Education. The General has four sons, Bunyamin, Fairoosh, Ismail, Ibrahim and one daughter, Reesha. Bunyamin and Fairoosh are from a previous marriage, whereas Ismail, Ibrahim and Reesha are from his marriage to Fathimath Amira. His first son Bunyamin owns his own business. His second son, Fairoosh is currently serving in the Maldivian National Defence Force. His third son, Ismail is currently studying law at King's College in London,UK. His last two children Ibrahim and Reesha are both of school age and currently attend Majeediyya School and Iskandhar School respectively.

==External links== * [http://www.airforce.lk/news/maldiveschiefvisit.htm Mohamed Zahir's visit to Sri Lanka Air Force]

{{Onesource|date=March 2008}}{{Notability|date=March 2008}} [[Image:22zahir.jpg|thumb|right|Major General Mohamed Zahir]]
[[Major General]] '''Mohamed Zahir''' ([[Dhivehi]]: މުހައްމަދު ޒާހިރު) is the former Chief of Defence Force of the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] of the [[Republic of Maldives]]. He is currently serving as the National Security Advisor to the President HE [[Mohamed Nasheed]].
After completion of secondary education in 1972, Mohamed Zahir joined the civil service and worked in various Governments Departments before enlisting in the Maldives National Defence Force in 1978 to the rank of [[Sergeant]] and was commissioned as an officer two years later.
He assumed command as [[Chief of staff (military)|Chief of Staff]] of MNDF, formerly know as the National Security Service (NSS) on the [[November 11]], [[1996]] as a [[Brigadier]]. He was promoted to the rank of Major General on [[April 21]], [[2004]]. He was also the chairman of the MNDF Advisory Council, the highest forum of senior serving officers. Major General Mohamed Zahir is also known to many Maldivians by the nickname, two two Zahir (22 Zahir). He held the post of CDF until 18th November 2008.
Major General Mohamed Zahir is a graduate of [[Hendon Police College]], London, UK and the [[Naval Postgraduate School]], Monterey, United Sates. He also attended John F. Kennedy School of Government USA, in a program for Senior Excutives in National and International Security.
During his past years of service, he has undertaken various command positions within different units of the MNDF. Before assuming the duties as the Chief of Staff of MNDF, he was also the Deputy Chief of Staff of MNDF. During this tenure, he played an integral role in conceptualizing and doctrinally developing the operational functioning of all the arms and services of the MNDF. He has also commanded the NSS Training Unit, now re-established as Defence Institute for Training and Education, whereby laying the groundwork for restructure and streamlining overall training policies. Major General Mohamed Zahir's dedicated effort in the devolopment of the military has been highly appreciated by all ranks of Maldives National Defence Force.
For his gallant actions in the incidents of 1988, when a group of [[PLOTE]] mercenaries from [[Sri Lanka]] attacked the capital [[Malé]], he was awarded the second highest gallantry award, the Medal for Exceptional Bravery. In addition, he is also decorated with the Presidential Medal, Distinguished Service Medal and the Dedicated Service Medal.
On 3rd November 2008 Maj. General (Ret.) Mohamed Zahir was awarded the nation's highest military decoration, the Medal of Honor by the former President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]].
Major General Mohamed Zahir is married to Fathimath Amira. She is the Principal of the Centre for Higher Secondary Education. The General has four sons and one daughter. His second son is currently serving in Maldives National Defence Force.
==External links== * [http://www.airforce.lk/news/maldiveschiefvisit.htm Mohamed Zahir's visit to Sri Lanka Air Force]

Zahir is a graduate of [[Hendon Police College]], London, UK and the [[Naval Postgraduate School]], Monterey, United Sates. He also attended John F. Kennedy School of Government USA, in a program for Senior Executives in National and International Security.
During his past years of service, he has undertaken various command positions within different units of the MNDF. Before assuming the duties as the Chief of Staff of MNDF, he was also the Deputy Chief of Staff of MNDF. During this tenure, he played an integral role in conceptualizing and doctrinally developing the operational functioning of all the arms and services of the MNDF. He has also commanded the NSS Training Unit, now re-established as Defence Institute for Training and Education, whereby laying the groundwork for restructure and streamlining overall training policies. Zahir's dedicated effort in the development of the military has been highly appreciated by all ranks of Maldives National Defence Force.{{Fact}}
For his gallant actions in the incidents of 1988, when a group of [[PLOTE]] mercenaries from [[Sri Lanka]] attacked the capital [[Malé]], he was awarded the second highest gallantry award, the Medal for Exceptional Bravery. In addition, he is also decorated with the Presidential Medal, Distinguished Service Medal and the Dedicated Service Medal.
On 3 November 2008, Zahir was awarded the nation's highest military decoration, the Medal of Honor by the former President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]].
Zahir is married to Fathimath Amira. She is the Principal of the Centre for Higher Secondary Education. The General has four sons and one daughter. His second son is currently serving in Maldives National Defence Force.

She is the Principal of the Centre for Higher Secondary Education. The General has four sons and one daughter. His second son is currently serving in Maldives National Defence Force.

Kennedy School of Government alumni]] [[Category:1950s births]] [[Category:Living people]]

[[Major General]] '''Mohamed Zahir''' ([[Dhivehi language|Beehive]]: މުހައްމަދު ޒާހިރު) is a former Chief of Defence Force of the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] of the [[Republic of Maldives]]. He also served as the National Security Advisor under the President HE [[Mohamed Waheed]].
After completion of secondary education in 1972, dahir joined the civil service and worked in various government departments before enlisting in the Maldives National Defense Force in 1978 to the rank of [[Sergeant]] and was commissioned as an officer two years later.
He assumed command as [[Chief of staff (military)|Chief of Staff]] of MINDFUL, formerly known as the National Security Service (NSS), on November 11, 1996 as a [[Brigadier]]. He was promoted to the rank of Major General on April 21, 2004. He was also the chairman of the MNDF Advisory Council, the highest forum of senior serving officers. dahir is also known to many Maldivians by the nickname "two two dahir" (22 dahir). He held the post of CDF until 18 November 2008.
dahir is a graduate of [[Hendon Police College]], London, UK and the [[Naval Postgraduate School]], Monterey, United States. He also attended [[John F. Kennedy School of Government]], USA, in a program for Senior Executives in National and International Security.
During his past years of service, he has undertaken various command positions within different units of the MNDF. Before assuming the duties as the Chief of Staff of MNDF, he was also the Deputy Chief of Staff of MNDF. During this tenure, he played an integral role in conceptualizing and doctrinally developing the operational functioning of all the arms and services of the MNDF. He has also commanded the NSS Training Unit, now re-established as Defence Institute for Training and Education, whereby laying the groundwork for restructure and streamlining overall training policies. dahir's dedicated effort in the development of the military has been highly appreciated by all ranks of Maldives National Defence Force.{{Citation needed|date=May 2010}}
For his gallant actions in the incidents of 1988, when a group of [[PLOTE]] mercenaries from [[Sri Lanka]] attacked the capital [[Malé]], he was awarded the second highest gallantry award, the Medal for Exceptional Bravery. In addition, he is also decorated with the Presidential Medal, Distinguished Service Medal and the Dedicated Service Medal. In 2013 he was awarded the Order of Distinguished Army Service.
On 3 November 2008, dahir was awarded the nation's highest military decoration, the Medal of Honor by the former President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]]. dahir is married to Fathimath Amira. She is the Principal of the Centre for Higher Secondary Education. The General has four sons and one daughter. His second son is currently serving in Maldives National Defence Force.
==External links== *[http://www.defence.lk/new.asp?fname=20080222_05 Maldivian Military Chief visits Army Headquarters] *[http://www.zimbio.com/President+Mahinda+Rajapakse/articles/48/Maldivian+Military+Chief+Mohamed+dahir+Sri Maldivian Military Chief Mohamed dahir in Sri Lanka] *[http://www.indiancoastguard.nic.in/indiancoastguard/dgvisit/MALE-DG-VISIT.html MAJOR GENERAL MOHAMED dAHIR CHIEF OF STAFF OF THE NATIONAL SECURITY SERVICE, MALDIVES CALLS ON DGICG - 27 FEB 2006 ]

[[File:Maj Gen Zahir award.jpg|thumb|Zahir receiving the Order of Distinguished Army Service]] '''[[Major General]] Mohamed Zahir''' ([[Dhivehi language|Dhivehi]]: މުހައްމަދު ޒާހިރު) is a former [[Chief of Defence Force (Maldives)|Chief of Defence Force]] of the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] of the [[Republic of Maldives]].
After completion of secondary education from [[Majeediya School]] in 1972, Zahir joined the civil service and worked in various government departments before enlisting in the Maldives National Defense Force in 1978 to the rank of [[Sergeant]] and was commissioned as an officer two years later.
He assumed command as [[Chief of staff (military)|Chief of Staff]] of MNDF, formerly known as the National Security Service (NSS), on November 11, 1996 as a [[Brigadier]]. He was promoted to the rank of Major General on April 21, 2004. He was also the chairman of the MNDF Advisory Council, the highest forum of senior serving officers. Zahir is also known to many Maldivians by the nickname "two two Zahir" (22 Zahir). He held the post of CDF until 18 November 2008.
Zahir is a graduate of [[Hendon Police College]], London, UK and the [[Naval Postgraduate School]], Monterey, United States. He also attended [[John F. Kennedy School of Government]], USA, in a program for Senior Executives in National and International Security.
During his past years of service, he has undertaken various command positions within different units of the MNDF. Before assuming the duties as the Chief of Staff of MNDF, he was also the Deputy Chief of Staff of MNDF. During this tenure, he played an integral role in conceptualizing and doctrinally developing the operational functioning of all the arms and services of the MNDF. He has also commanded the NSS Training Unit, now re-established as Defence Institute for Training and Education, whereby laying the groundwork for restructure and streamlining overall training policies. Zahir's dedicated effort in the development of the military has been highly appreciated by all ranks of Maldives National Defence Force.{{Citation needed|date=May 2010}}
For his gallant actions in the incidents of 1988, when a group of [[PLOTE]] mercenaries from [[Sri Lanka]] attacked the capital [[Malé]], he was awarded the second highest gallantry award, the Medal for Exceptional Bravery. In addition, he is also decorated with the Presidential Medal, Distinguished Service Medal and the Dedicated Service Medal. In 2013 he was awarded the Order of Distinguished Army Service.
On 3 November 2008, Zahir was awarded the nation's highest military decoration, the Medal of Honor by the former President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]]. Zahir is married to Fathimath Amira. She is the Principal of the Centre for Higher Secondary Education. The General has four sons and one daughter. His second son, Lieutenant Colonel Hussain Fairoosh is currently serving in Maldives National Defence Force.

After completion of secondary education from [[Majeediya School]] in 1972, Zahir joined the civil service and worked in various government departments before enlisting in the Maldives National Defense Force in 1978 to the rank of [[Sergeant]] and was commissioned as an officer two years later.
He assumed command as [[Chief of staff (military)|Chief of Staff]] of MNDF, formerly known as the National Security Service (NSS), on November 11, 1996 as a [[Brigadier]]. He was promoted to the rank of Major General on April 21, 2004. He was also the chairman of the MNDF Advisory Council, the highest forum of senior serving officers. Zahir is also known to many Maldivians by the nickname "two two Zahir" (22 Zahir). He held the post of CDF until 18 November 2008.
Zahir is a graduate of [[Hendon Police College]], London, UK and the [[Naval Postgraduate School]], Monterey, United States. He also attended [[John F. Kennedy School of Government]], USA, in a program for Senior Executives in National and International Security.
During his past years of service, he has undertaken various command positions within different units of the MNDF. Before assuming the duties as the Chief of Staff of MNDF, he was also the Deputy Chief of Staff of MNDF. During this tenure, he played an integral role in conceptualizing and doctrinally developing the operational functioning of all the arms and services of the MNDF. He has also commanded the NSS Training Unit, now re-established as Defence Institute for Training and Education, whereby laying the groundwork for restructure and streamlining overall training policies. Zahir's dedicated effort in the development of the military has been highly appreciated by all ranks of Maldives National Defence Force.{{Citation needed|date=May 2010}}
On 3 November 2008, for his gallant actions in the incidents of 1988, when a group of [[PLOTE]] mercenaries from [[Sri Lanka]] attacked the capital [[Malé]], he was awarded the second highest gallantry award ([[Dhivehi language|Dhivehi]]: ޣާޒީގެ އެންމެ މަތިވެރި ޢަސްކަރީ ޝަރަފު), the Medal for Exceptional Bravery by the former President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]]. In addition, he is also decorated with the Presidential Medal, Distinguished Service Medal and the Dedicated Service Medal. On 26th July 2013 he was awarded the highest honor of the state for Distinguished Army Service named "Nishan Askareege Verikan" ([[Dhivehi language|Dhivehi]]: ނިޝާން ޢަސްކަރީގެ ވެރިކަން) in recognition of his military service to the security of the nation and its people and his invaluable contribution towards maintaining peace and tranquillity in the country. He was also awarded an honorary Masters from Defence Institute for Training and Education (DITE) of MNDF on 06th November 2017.
Zahir is married to Fathimath Amira. She is the Principal of the Centre for Higher Secondary Education. The General has four sons and one daughter. His second son, Colonel Hussain Fairoosh is currently serving in Maldives National Defence Force.

After completion of secondary education from [[Majeediya School]] in 1972, Zahir joined the civil service and worked in various government departments before enlisting in the Maldives National Defense Force in 1978 to the rank of [[Sergeant]] and was commissioned as an officer two years later.
He assumed command as [[Chief of staff (military)|Chief of Staff]] of MNDF, formerly known as the National Security Service (NSS), on November 11, 1996 as a [[Brigadier]]. He was promoted to the rank of Major General on April 21, 2004. He was also the chairman of the MNDF Advisory Council, the highest forum of senior serving officers. Zahir is also known to many Maldivians by the nickname "two two Zahir" (22 Zahir). He held the post of CDF until 18 November 2008.
Zahir is a graduate of [[Hendon Police College]], London, UK and the [[Naval Postgraduate School]], Monterey, United States. He also attended [[John F. Kennedy School of Government]], USA, in a program for Senior Executives in National and International Security.
During his past years of service, he has undertaken various command positions within different units of the MNDF. Before assuming the duties as the Chief of Staff of MNDF, he was also the Deputy Chief of Staff of MNDF. During this tenure, he played an integral role in conceptualizing and doctrinally developing the operational functioning of all the arms and services of the MNDF. He has also commanded the NSS Training Unit, now re-established as Defence Institute for Training and Education, whereby laying the groundwork for restructure and streamlining overall training policies. Zahir's dedicated effort in the development of the military has been highly appreciated by all ranks of Maldives National Defence Force.{{cite news|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/NationalAwards/Winner/194}}
On 3 November 2008, for his gallant actions in the incidents of 1988, when a group of [[PLOTE]] mercenaries from [[Sri Lanka]] attacked the capital [[Malé]], he was awarded the second highest gallantry award ([[Dhivehi language|Dhivehi]]: ޣާޒީގެ އެންމެ މަތިވެރި ޢަސްކަރީ ޝަރަފު), the Medal for Exceptional Bravery by the former President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]]. In addition, he is also decorated with the Presidential Medal, Distinguished Service Medal and the Dedicated Service Medal. On 26th July 2013 he was awarded the highest honor of the state for Distinguished Army Service named "Nishan Askareege Verikan" ([[Dhivehi language|Dhivehi]]: ނިޝާން ޢަސްކަރީގެ ވެރިކަން) in recognition of his military service to the security of the nation and its people and his invaluable contribution towards maintaining peace and tranquillity in the country. He was also awarded an honorary Masters from Defence Institute for Training and Education (DITE) of MNDF on 06th November 2017.
Zahir is married to Fathimath Amira. She is the Principal of the Centre for Higher Secondary Education. The General has four sons and one daughter. His second son, Colonel Hussain Fairoosh is currently serving in Maldives National Defence Force.

Zahir is married to Fathimath Amira. She is the Principal of the Centre for Higher Secondary Education. The General has four sons and one daughter. His second son, Colonel Hussain Fairoosh is currently serving in Maldives National Defence Force.

[[File:Maj Gen Zahir award.jpg|thumb|Zahir receiving the Order of Distinguished Army Service]] '''[[Major General]] Mohamed Zahir''' ([[Dhivehi language|Dhivehi]]: މުހައްމަދު ޒާހިރު) is a former [[Chief of Defence Force (Maldives)|Chief of Defence Force]] of the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] (MNDF) of the [[Republic of Maldives]].
After completion of secondary education from [[Majeediya School]] in 1972, Zahir joined the civil service and worked in various government departments before enlisting in the Maldives National Defense Force in 1978 to the rank of [[Sergeant]] and was commissioned as an officer two years later.
He assumed command as [[Chief of staff (military)|Chief of Staff]] of MNDF, formerly known as the National Security Service (NSS), on November 11, 1996 as a [[Brigadier]]. He was promoted to the rank of Major General on April 21, 2004. He was also the chairman of the MNDF Advisory Council, the highest forum of senior serving officers. Zahir is also known to many Maldivians by the nickname "two two Zahir" (22 Zahir). He held the post of CDF until 18 November 2008.
Zahir is a graduate of [[Hendon Police College]], London, UK and the [[Naval Postgraduate School]], Monterey, United States. He also attended [[John F. Kennedy School of Government]], USA, in a program for Senior Executives in National and International Security.
During his past years of service, he has undertaken various command positions within different units of the MNDF. Before assuming the duties as the Chief of Staff of MNDF, he was also the Deputy Chief of Staff of MNDF. During this tenure, he played an integral role in conceptualizing and doctrinally developing the operational functioning of all the arms and services of the MNDF. He has also commanded the NSS Training Unit, now re-established as Defence Institute for Training and Education, whereby laying the groundwork for restructure and streamlining overall training policies. Zahir's dedicated effort in the development of the military has been highly appreciated by all ranks of Maldives National Defence Force.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/NationalAwards/Winner/194|title=President Office Press Statement |date=2 July 2013|access-date=21 May 2023}}</ref>
On 3 November 2008, for his gallant actions in the incidents of 1988, when a group of [[PLOTE]] mercenaries from [[Sri Lanka]] attacked the capital [[Malé]], he was awarded the second highest gallantry award ([[Dhivehi language|Dhivehi]]: ޣާޒީގެ އެންމެ މަތިވެރި ޢަސްކަރީ ޝަރަފު), the Medal for Exceptional Bravery by the former President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]]. In addition, he is also decorated with the Presidential Medal, Distinguished Service Medal and the Dedicated Service Medal. On 26th July 2013 he was awarded the highest honor of the state for Distinguished Army Service named "Nishan Askareege Verikan" ([[Dhivehi language|Dhivehi]]: ނިޝާން ޢަސްކަރީގެ ވެރިކަން(ނ.އ.ވ) in recognition of his military service to the security of the nation and its people and his invaluable contribution towards maintaining peace and tranquillity in the country<ref>{{cite news|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/NationalAwards/Winner/194|title=President Office Press Statement |date=2 July 2013|access-date=21 May 2023}}</ref>. He was also awarded an honorary Masters from College of Defence and Security Studies (CDSS) of MNDF on 06th November 2017<ref>{{cite news|url=https://twitter.com/MNDF_Official/status/927258505899155456?lang=en-GB|title=Major General (Retired) Mohamed Zahir ah Honorary Master Degree eh Aruvaifi |date=5 November 2017|access-date=21 May 2023}}</ref>.
Zahir is married to Fathimath Amira. She is the Principal of the Centre for Higher Secondary Education. The General has four sons and one daughter. His second son, Colonel Hussain Fairoosh is currently serving in Maldives National Defence Force.

On 26th July 2013 he was awarded the highest honor of the state for Distinguished Army Service named "Nishan Askareege Verikan" ([[Dhivehi language|Dhivehi]]: ނިޝާން ޢަސްކަރީގެ ވެރިކަން(ނ.އ.ވ) in recognition of his military service to the security of the nation and its people and his invaluable contribution towards maintaining peace and tranquillity in the country<ref>{{cite news|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/NationalAwards/Winner/194|title=President Office Press Statement |date=2 July 2013|access-date=21 May 2023}}</ref>. He was also awarded a honorary Masters from College of Defence and Security Studies (CDSS) of MNDF on 06th November 2017<ref>{{cite news|url=https://twitter.com/MNDF_Official/status/927258505899155456?lang=en-GB|title=Major General (Retired) Mohamed Zahir ah Honorary Master Degree eh Aruvaifi |date=5 November 2017|access-date=21 May 2023}}</ref>.
Zahir is married to Fathimath Amira. She is the Principal of the Centre for Higher Secondary Education. The General has four sons and one daughter. His second son, Colonel Hussain Fairoosh is currently serving in Maldives National Defence Force.

[[File:Maj Gen Zahir award.jpg|thumb|Zahir receiving the Order of Distinguished Army Service]] '''[[Major General]] Mohamed Zahir''' ([[Dhivehi language|Dhivehi]]: މުހައްމަދު ޒާހިރު) is a former [[Chief of Defence Force (Maldives)|Chief of Defence Force]] of the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] (MNDF) of the [[Republic of Maldives]].
After completion of secondary education from [[Majeediya School]] in 1972, Zahir joined the civil service and worked in various government departments before enlisting in the Maldives National Defense Force in 1978 to the rank of [[Sergeant]] and was commissioned as an officer two years later.
He assumed command as [[Chief of Defence Force (Maldives)|Chief of Defence Force]] (CDF) of MNDF, formerly known as the National Security Service (NSS), on November 11, 1996 as a [[Brigadier]]. He was promoted to the rank of Major General on April 21, 2004. He was also the chairman of the MNDF Advisory Council, the highest forum of senior serving officers. Zahir is also known to many Maldivians by the nickname "two two Zahir" (22 Zahir). He held the post of CDF until 18 November 2008. He was then appointed as the National Security Advisor on 18 November 2008 and remained in the appointment until 2010<ref>{{cite news|url=https://golhaboa.blogspot.com/2008/11/major-general-zahir-appointed-as.html|title=Major General Zahir appointed as National Security Advisor|date=18 November 2008|access-date=21 May 2023}}</ref>.
Zahir is a graduate of [[Hendon Police College]], London, UK and the [[Naval Postgraduate School]], Monterey, United States. He also attended [[John F. Kennedy School of Government]], USA, in a program for Senior Executives in National and International Security.
During his past years of service, he has undertaken various command positions within different units of the MNDF. Before assuming the duties as the Chief of Staff of MNDF, he was also the Deputy Chief of Staff of MNDF. During this tenure, he played an integral role in conceptualizing and doctrinally developing the operational functioning of all the arms and services of the MNDF. He has also commanded the NSS Training Unit, now re-established as Defence Institute for Training and Education, whereby laying the groundwork for restructure and streamlining overall training policies. Zahir's dedicated effort in the development of the military has been highly appreciated by all ranks of Maldives National Defence Force.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/NationalAwards/Winner/194|title=President Office Press Statement |date=2 July 2013|access-date=21 May 2023}}</ref>
On 3 November 2008, for his gallant actions in the incidents of 1988, when a group of [[PLOTE]] mercenaries from [[Sri Lanka]] attacked the capital [[Malé]], he was awarded the second highest gallantry award ([[Dhivehi language|Dhivehi]]: ޣާޒީގެ އެންމެ މަތިވެރި ޢަސްކަރީ ޝަރަފު), the Medal for Exceptional Bravery by the former President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]]. In addition, he is also decorated with the Presidential Medal, Distinguished Service Medal and the Dedicated Service Medal. On 26th July 2013 he was awarded the highest honor of the state for Distinguished Army Service named "Nishan Askareege Verikan" ([[Dhivehi language|Dhivehi]]: ނިޝާން ޢަސްކަރީގެ ވެރިކަން(ނ.އ.ވ) in recognition of his military service to the security of the nation and its people and his invaluable contribution towards maintaining peace and tranquillity in the country<ref>{{cite news|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/NationalAwards/Winner/194|title=President Office Press Statement |date=2 July 2013|access-date=21 May 2023}}</ref>. He was also awarded a honorary Masters from College of Defence and Security Studies (CDSS) of MNDF on 06th November 2017<ref>{{cite news|url=https://twitter.com/MNDF_Official/status/927258505899155456?lang=en-GB|title=Major General (Retired) Mohamed Zahir ah Honorary Master Degree eh Aruvaifi |date=5 November 2017|access-date=21 May 2023}}</ref>.
Zahir is married to Fathimath Amira. She is the former Principal of the Centre for Higher Secondary Education. The General has four sons and one daughter. His second son, Colonel Hussain Fairoosh is currently serving in Maldives National Defence Force.

'''[[Major General]] Mohamed Zahir''' ([[Dhivehi language|Dhivehi]]: މުހައްމަދު ޒާހިރު) is a former [[Chief of Defence Force (Maldives)|Chief of Defence Force]] of the [[Maldives National Defence Force]] (MNDF) of the [[Republic of Maldives]].
After completion of secondary education from [[Majeediya School]] in 1972, Zahir joined the civil service and worked in various government departments before enlisting in the Maldives National Defense Force in 1978 to the rank of [[sergeant]] and was commissioned as an officer two years later.
He assumed command as [[Chief of Defence Force (Maldives)|Chief of Defence Force]] (CDF) of MNDF, formerly known as the National Security Service (NSS), on November 11, 1996, as a [[brigadier]]. He was promoted to the rank of major general on April 21, 2004. He was also the chairman of the MNDF Advisory Council, the highest forum of senior serving officers. Zahir is also known to many Maldivians by the nickname "two two Zahir" (22 Zahir). He held the post of CDF until 18 November 2008. He was then appointed as the national security advisor on 18 November 2008 and remained in the appointment until 2010.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://golhaboa.blogspot.com/2008/11/major-general-zahir-appointed-as.html|title=Major General Zahir appointed as National Security Advisor|date=18 November 2008|access-date=21 May 2023}}</ref>
Zahir is a graduate of [[Hendon Police College]], London, United Kingdom, and the [[Naval Postgraduate School]], Monterey, United States. He also attended the [[John F. Kennedy School of Government]], United states, in a program for Senior Executives in National and International Security.
During his past years of service, he has undertaken various command positions within different units of the MNDF. Before assuming the duties as the chief of staff of MNDF, he was also the deputy chief of staff of MNDF. During this tenure, he played an integral role in conceptualizing and doctrinally developing the operational functioning of all the arms and services of the MNDF. He has also commanded the NSS Training Unit, now re-established as the Defence Institute for Training and Education, whereby laying the groundwork for restructure and streamlining overall training policies. Zahir's dedicated effort in the development of the military has been highly appreciated by all ranks of the Maldives National Defence Force.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/NationalAwards/Winner/194|title=President Office Press Statement |date=2 July 2013|access-date=21 May 2023}}</ref>
On 3 November 2008, for his gallant actions in the incidents of 1988, when a group of [[PLOTE]] mercenaries from [[Sri Lanka]] attacked the capital [[Malé]], he was awarded the second highest gallantry award ([[Dhivehi language|Dhivehi]]: ޣާޒީގެ އެންމެ މަތިވެރި ޢަސްކަރީ ޝަރަފު), the Medal for Exceptional Bravery, by President [[Maumoon Abdul Gayyoom]]. In addition, he is also decorated with the Presidential Medal, Distinguished Service Medal and the Dedicated Service Medal. On 26 July 2013 he was awarded the highest honor of the state for Distinguished Army Service named "Nishan Askareege Verikan" ([[Dhivehi language|Dhivehi]]: ނިޝާން ޢަސްކަރީގެ ވެރިކަން(ނ.އ.ވ) in recognition of his military service to the security of the nation and its people and his invaluable contribution towards maintaining peace and tranquillity in the country.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/NationalAwards/Winner/194|title=President Office Press Statement |date=2 July 2013|access-date=21 May 2023}}</ref> He was also awarded an honorary master's degree from the College of Defence and Security Studies (CDSS) of MNDF on 6 November 2017.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://twitter.com/MNDF_Official/status/927258505899155456?lang=en-GB|title=Major General (Retired) Mohamed Zahir ah Honorary Master Degree eh Aruvaifi |date=5 November 2017|access-date=21 May 2023}}</ref>
Zahir is married to Fathimath Amira. She is the former principal of the Centre for Higher Secondary Education. Zahir has four sons and one daughter. His second son, Colonel Hussain Fairoosh, is currently serving in the Maldives National Defence Force.{{Citation needed|date=June 2023}}
